cards.name: Wake of Vultures
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Wake of Vultures.
cards.flavor:
"So the vulture said to the griffin, 'You gonna eat that?'"
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Wake of Vultures to activate its own ability. The ability will have no effect as it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate

cards.name: Wicked Reward
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Target creature gets +4/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The blood on my hands is merely proof of my ambition."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +4/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Betrayal
cards.text:
Enchant creature an opponent controls
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, you draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Sometimes a burden can be borne only on the shoulders of a willing enemy."
—Suq'Ata aphorism

rulings.text: If it ever enchants a creature that isn't controlled by an opponent of Betrayal's controller, then it's put into the graveyard as a State-Based Action.

cards.originalText:
Play only on a creature an opponent controls.
If enchanted creature becomes tapped, draw a card.

cards.name: Breezekeeper
cards.text:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
cards.flavor:
"He blows a gust across the cliff to vanish in a breath of wind."
—"Song of the Wind Being"
cards.originalText: Flying, phasing

cards.name: Chronatog
cards.text: {0}: Chronatog gets +3/+3 until end of turn. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: For the chronatog, there is no meal like the present.

rulings.text: You can only activate the ability once each turn for each Chronatog.

cards.originalText: Skip your next turn: Chronatog gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Use this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Cloud Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"You know you've angered the gods when the clouds turn against you."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText:
Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Desertion
cards.text: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.
cards.flavor: First the insult, then the injury.

rulings.text: The card is put onto the battlefield, but any effects that check if the original card was "cast from your hand" will not trigger or otherwise consider the card to have been cast from your hand. The card was put onto the battlefield by the effect of Desertion instead.
This spell includes a replacement effect. If the target is an artifact or creature, it never goes to the graveyard.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then this card's ability does not put the card onto the battlefield. The spell continues to resolve as normal.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. If that spell is an artifact or summon spell, put that card into play under your control as though it were just played.

cards.name: Dream Tides
cards.text:
Creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped nongreen creatures they control and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

rulings.text: You can only untap nongreen creatures once, since this has a beginning of upkeep triggered ability.

cards.originalText:
Creatures do not untap during their controllers' untap phase.
Each nongreen creature's controller may pay an additional {2} during his or her upkeep to untap that creature.

cards.name: Flooded Shoreline
cards.text: {U}{U}, Return two Islands you control to their owner's hand: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Some say the sea is jealous of the land and wishes to climb its heights to meet the sky."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: {U}{U}, Return two islands you control to owner's hand: Return target creature to owner's hand.

cards.name: Foreshadow
cards.text:
Choose a card name, then target opponent puts the top card of their library into their graveyard. If that card has the chosen name, you draw a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: You name the card on resolution.

cards.originalText:
Name a card. Put the top card from target opponent's library into his or her graveyard. If that card is the one named, draw a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Impulse
cards.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again."
—Teferi

rulings.text: This is not a draw.
Due to errata, you no longer shuffle your library.

cards.originalText: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Inspiration
cards.text: Target player draws two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.originalText: Target player draws two cards.

cards.name: Knight of the Mists
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
When Knight of the Mists enters the battlefield, you may pay {U}. If you don't, destroy target Knight and it can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Fear the mists, for they are armed.

rulings.text: If no other Knights are on the battlefield, pay the mana or destroy this card.
Can destroy an opponent's knight.

cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
When Knight of the Mists comes into play, pay {U} or bury target Knight.

cards.name: Man-o'-War
cards.text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

cards.originalText: When Man-o'-War comes into play, return target creature to owner's hand.

cards.name: Mystic Veil
cards.text:
You may cast Mystic Veil as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"Magic is my thread, my will the needle. I weave over you as if you never were."
—Poetics of Hanan

rulings.text: Does not destroy Auras which are already on the creature.
The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
You may choose to play Mystic Veil as an instant; if you do, bury it at end of turn.
Enchanted creature cannot be the target of spells or effects.

cards.name: Ovinomancer
cards.text:
When Ovinomancer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return three basic lands you control to their owner's hand.
{T}, Return Ovinomancer to its owner's hand: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. That creature's controller creates a 0/1 green Sheep creature token.

rulings.text: Can target itself. This will cause it to be returned to your hand during announcement and will result in no sheep since it will not be on the battlefield at resolution so the effect fails since it target is illegal.

cards.originalText:
When Ovinomancer comes into play, return three basic lands you control to owner's hand or bury Ovinomancer.
{T}, Return Ovinomancer to owner's hand: Bury target creature and put a Sheep token into play under the control of the creature's controller. Treat this token as a 0/1 green creature.

cards.name: Prosperity
cards.text: Each player draws X cards.
cards.flavor:
"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

rulings.text: If both players run out of cards during this effect, the game is a draw.

cards.originalText: Each player draws X cards.

cards.name: Rainbow Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
{U}{U}: Rainbow Efreet phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
cards.flavor:
"A beauty made more so by its fleeting visitations."
—Teferi
cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}{U}: Phase out

cards.name: Shimmering Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Whenever Shimmering Efreet phases in, target creature phases out. (It phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
cards.flavor:
Life or death: which is the illusion?"
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

rulings.text: If it phases in and no other creatures are on the battlefield, it will phase itself back out.
If two of these phase in, they can both target the same creature and have just that one creature phase out.

cards.originalText:
Flying, phasing
When Shimmering Efreet phases in, target creature phases out.

cards.name: Shrieking Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Shrieking Drake enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Kaervek believes the drakes' cries herald his victory; in truth, they mourn aloud for his impending demise."
—Teferi

rulings.text: You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Shrieking Drake comes into play, return a creature you control to owner's hand.

cards.name: Teferi's Realm
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses artifact, creature, land, or non-Aura enchantment. All nontoken permanents of that type phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. Each one phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
cards.flavor:
"Fire is dead. Water has killed him."
—From The Stories of Nature

rulings.text: Does not affect token permanents, only cards.
Can affect itself if you choose "non-Aura enchantment".

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses artifacts, creatures, lands, or global enchantments. All cards of that type phase out.

cards.name: Three Wishes
cards.text: Exile the top three cards of your library face down. You may look at those cards for as long as they remain exiled. Until your next turn, you may play those cards. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put any of those cards you didn't play into your graveyard.

rulings.text: You can look at the three exiled cards at any time.
You can only play them before the start of your upkeep. Between the start of your upkeep and putting the extra cards into the graveyard, you can't play them.
To "play a card" is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.

cards.originalText: Take the top three cards from your library, look at them, and set them aside face down. You may play those cards as though they were in your hand. At the beginning of your next turn, bury any of those cards not played.

cards.name: Time and Tide
cards.text: Simultaneously, all phased-out creatures phase in and all creatures with phasing phase out.
cards.flavor:
"Time may heal all wounds, but what heals time?"
—Teferi
cards.originalText: All creatures that are phased out phase in and all creatures with phasing phase out.

cards.name: Undo
cards.text: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"Oft have I wished to undo past deeds, but never did I imagine they would be undone for me."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

rulings.text: The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner's hands.

cards.originalText: Return two target creatures to owner's hand.

cards.name: Vanishing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{U}{U}: Enchanted creature phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
cards.flavor:
"Careless, like a child with fire, so was I with time."
—Teferi
cards.originalText: {U}{U}: Enchanted creature phases out.

cards.name: Vision Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player puts the top four cards of their library into their graveyard.
• Choose a land type and a basic land type. Each land of the first chosen type becomes the second chosen type until end of turn.
• Target artifact phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)

rulings.text: All lands changed are changed to the same type.

cards.originalText: Choose one Target artifact phases out; or put the top four cards from target player's library into his or her graveyard; or all lands of one type are basic lands of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Waterspout Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Waterspout Djinn unless you return an untapped Island you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Fly us higher, out of its storm."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: You choose a land to return and return it during resolution of the upkeep triggered ability. This means if you have two Waterspout Djinns, they must each return different Islands.

cards.originalText:
Flying
During your upkeep, return an untapped island you control to owner's hand or bury Waterspout Djinn.

cards.name: Bull Elephant
cards.text: When Bull Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return two Forests you control to their owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
Four gray trees and a long, coiling snake. What am I?
—Zhalfirin riddle
cards.originalText: When Bull Elephant comes into play, return two forests you control to owner's hand or bury Bull Elephant.

cards.name: City of Solitude
cards.text: Players can cast spells and activate abilities only during their own turns.
cards.flavor:
"My horizon was the arcing petals, my new home resplendent with spires of weeds and pillows of fragrant pollen."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

rulings.text: City of Solitude can affect abilities of cards that are not on the battlefield because it prevents players from activating those abilities.
City of Solitude does not stop triggered abilities from being put on the stack. They are never "activated".
This stops players from activating mana abilities.

cards.originalText: Each player may play spells and abilities only during his or her turn.

cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.flavor:
"Mold could catch you."
—Suq'Ata insult
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, land, or enchantment.

cards.name: Elephant Grass
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Black creatures can't attack you.
Nonblack creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
cards.flavor:
"How have I angered nature that she would imprison me in a labyrinth of grass?"
—Kasib ibn Naji, Letters

rulings.text: Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {1}
Black creatures cannot attack you. Nonblack creatures cannot attack you unless their controller pays an additional {2} for each attacking creature.

cards.name: Elven Cache
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"The elves can hide better than most can look."
—Mwani, Mtenda herder
cards.originalText: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Emerald Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Untap target permanent.
• Destroy target non-Aura enchantment.
• Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one Untap target permanent; or destroy target global enchantment; or target creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Feral Instinct
cards.text:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"If a rhino's head is lower than its shoulders, trust me—it is not praying."
—Mwani, Mtenda herder
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Giant Caterpillar
cards.text: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Create a 1/1 green Insect creature token with flying named Butterfly at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"'I've seen hornworms big as a man's fist,' the traveler said, and nodded soberly when our jaws went slack at his ignorance."
—Afari, Tales

rulings.text: It used to make Butterfly tokens. Now it makes Insect tokens named Butterfly.

cards.originalText: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Put a Butterfly token into play at end of turn. Treat this token as a 1/1 green creature with flying.

cards.name: Katabatic Winds
cards.text:
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Creatures with flying can't attack or block, and their activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.
cards.flavor: Wind will win, whatever we wish.

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Phasing
Creatures with flying cannot attack, block, or use any ability that includes {T} in the activation cost.

cards.name: King Cheetah
cards.text: Flash
cards.flavor:
If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a King Cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.
—Suq'Ata wisdom

rulings.text: King Cheetah is always a Creature spell, never an instant, regardless of when you cast it.

cards.originalText: You may choose to play King Cheetah whenever you could play an instant.

cards.name: Kyscu Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{G}: Kyscu Drake gets +0/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
Sacrifice Kyscu Drake and a creature named Spitting Drake: Search your library for a card named Viashivan Dragon and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{G}: +0/+1 until end of turn. You cannot spend more than {G} in this way each turn.
Sacrifice Kyscu Drake and Spitting Drake: Search your library for Viashivan Dragon and put it into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Lichenthrope
cards.text:
If damage would be dealt to Lichenthrope, put that many -1/-1 counters on it instead.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a -1/-1 counter from Lichenthrope.

rulings.text: This card's effect replaces damage with placement of -1/-1 counters, so side-effects of damage to it will not trigger.

cards.originalText:
For each 1 damage dealt to Lichenthrope, put a -1/-1 counter on it instead.
During your upkeep, remove one of these -1/-1 counters from Lichenthrope.

cards.name: Mortal Wound
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
cards.flavor:
"Their tears spill over Jamuraa. Mixed with blood, they wash everything red."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText: If damage is dealt to enchanted creature, destroy it.

cards.name: Natural Order
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a green creature.
Search your library for a green creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: . . . but the price of Mangara's freedom was Asmira's life.

rulings.text: Sacrificing a green creature is part of Natural Order's cost. You can't sacrifice more creatures to search for more creature cards, and you can't cast Natural Order at all if you control no green creatures.

Players can respond to this spell only after it's been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to stop you from casting this spell or to make you sacrifice a different one.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a green creature: Search your library for a green creature card and put it into play as though it were just played. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Panther Warriors
cards.flavor:
"When you run you're graceful and swift, sleek as a powerful panther."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

cards.name: Quirion Druid
cards.text: {G}, {T}: Target land becomes a 2/2 green creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor:
"The land has been gracious enough to let you tread upon her for years. That privilege is about to end."
—Liefellen, Quirion exarch

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Target land becomes a 2/2 green creature permanently. That land still counts as a land.

cards.name: Quirion Ranger
cards.text: Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"Respect the earth, for it will one day be your shield and another day your blanket."
—Liefellen, Quirion exarch

rulings.text: It can target an untapped creature.

cards.originalText: Return a forest you control to owner's hand: Untap target creature. Use this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: River Boa
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.
cards.flavor:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText:
Islandwalk (If defending player controls an island, this creature is unblockable.)
{G}: Regenerate

cards.name: Rowen
cards.text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

rulings.text: The first sentence is a continuous ability. You reveal the card when you draw it, during the resolution of any draw effect. The second sentence is a triggered ability, and thus will wait until the entire draw effect finishes resolving before you do it.

cards.originalText: During your draw phase, reveal the first card you draw to all players. If that card is a basic land, draw a card.

cards.name: Spider Climb
cards.text:
You may cast Spider Climb as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+3 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

rulings.text: The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
You may choose to play Spider Climb as an instant; if you do, bury it at end of turn.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+3 and can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Stampeding Wildebeests
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Prayers for rain are answered with the thunder of hooves.

rulings.text: The ability that returns a creature doesn't target anything. You can return a creature with shroud or protection from green, for example. You don't decide which creature to return until the ability resolves. If you control no other green creatures, you must return Stampeding Wildebeests itself.
You choose a creature and return it all during resolution of the triggered ability. This means that if you have two Wildebeests, there is no way to end up returning only one creature.

cards.originalText:
Trample
During your upkeep, return a green creature you control to owner's hand.

cards.name: Summer Bloom
cards.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Our love is like the river in the summer season of long rains. / For a little while it spilled its banks, flooding the crops in the fields."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

cards.originalText: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.

cards.name: Uktabi Orangutan
cards.text: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
cards.originalText: When Uktabi Orangutan comes into play, destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Warthog
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
"Too much work—it takes a long time to break them in, and more than a few recruits."
—Grebog, goblin swine-rider
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player controls any swamps, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Wind Shear
cards.text: Attacking creatures with flying get -2/-2 and lose flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"As the winds abated, there was a shower of dragonscales, then nothing more."
—Azeworai, "The Unruly Wind"

rulings.text: The -2/-2 and loss of Flying both last until end of turn. The -2/-2 is not permanent.

cards.originalText: All attacking creatures with flying get -2/-2 and lose flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Bogardan Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying
When Bogardan Phoenix dies, exile it if it had a death counter on it. Otherwise, return it to the battlefield under your control and put a death counter on it.

rulings.text: Errata streamlined the trigger and got rid of the replacement effect. In both cases, it will go to the graveyard. In one it will then come back onto the battlefield; in the other it will then be exiled.

cards.originalText:
Flying
If Bogardan Phoenix is put into any graveyard from play and has no death counter on it, return Bogardan Phoenix to play and put a death counter on it.
If Bogardan Phoenix is put into any graveyard from play and has a death counter on it, remove it from the game.

cards.name: Dwarven Vigilantes
cards.text: Whenever Dwarven Vigilantes attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Dwarven Vigilantes assigns no combat damage this turn.
cards.flavor: Some dwarves can only be pushed so far.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: If Dwarven Vigilantes attacks and is not blocked, you may choose to have it deal no combat damage this turn. If you do, Dwarven Vigilantes deals an amount of damage equal to its power to target creature.

cards.name: Elkin Lair
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player exiles a card at random from their hand. The player may play that card this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, if the player hasn't played the card, they put it into their graveyard.

rulings.text: You can play the card this turn, not just during the resolution of the ability.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, that player chooses a card at random from his or her hand and sets it aside face up. The player may play that card as though it were in his or her hand. If the player does not play the card by end of turn, bury that card.

cards.name: Fireblast
cards.text:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Fireblast deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Embermages aren't well known for their diplomatic skills.
cards.originalText: You may sacrifice two mountains instead of paying Fireblast's casting cost. Fireblast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Goblin Recruiter
cards.text: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.
cards.flavor: "Next!"

rulings.text: You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.originalText: When Goblin Recruiter comes into play, search your library for any number of Goblin cards. Reveal those cards to all players. Shuffle your library, then put the cards on top of your library in any order.

cards.name: Goblin Swine-Rider
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Swine-Rider becomes blocked, it deals 2 damage to each attacking creature and each blocking creature.
cards.flavor:
"May you get the mount you deserve."
—Suq'Ata curse
cards.originalText: If Goblin Swine-Rider is blocked, it deals 2 damage to each attacking creature and 2 damage to each blocking creature.

cards.name: Hearth Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact creature.
• Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one Destroy target artifact creature; or all attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn; or target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Heat Wave
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Blue creatures can't block creatures you control.
Nonblue creatures can't block creatures you control unless their controller pays 1 life for each blocking creature they control.
cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {R}
Blue creatures cannot block creatures you control. Nonblue creatures cannot block creatures you control unless their controller pays an additional 1 life for each blocking creature.

cards.name: Hulking Cyclops
cards.text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
cards.flavor:
"Some say a great cyclops turns the world in its hands, looking down upon it with its one bright eye."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: Hulking Cyclops cannot block.

cards.name: Keeper of Kookus
cards.text: {R}: Keeper of Kookus gains protection from red until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Wanted: Thick-skinned goblin for guarding mean ol' Kookus. Must like fires. Must heal quickly.
cards.originalText: {R}: Protection from red until end of turn.

cards.name: Kookus
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you don't control a creature named Keeper of Kookus, Kookus deals 3 damage to you and attacks this turn if able.
{R}: Kookus gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Trample
During your upkeep, if you do not control at least one Keeper of Kookus, Kookus deals 3 damage to you and attacks this turn if able.
{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lightning Cloud
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {R}. If you do, Lightning Cloud deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
The mightiest clouds sit upon spires of fire.
—Femeref adage

rulings.text: Triggers when the spell is cast.
You pick the target when putting the triggered ability on the stack, but you don't choose whether or not to pay {R} until the triggered ability resolves.

cards.originalText: {R}: Lightning Cloud deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Use this ability only when a red spell is successfully cast and only once for each such spell.

cards.name: Mob Mentality
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has trample.
Whenever all non-Wall creatures you control attack, enchanted creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of attacking creatures.
cards.flavor:
"Why is loud stupidity so infectious?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gains trample.
If all non-Wall creatures you control attack, enchanted creature gets +*/+0 until end of turn, where * is equal to the number of attacking creatures.

cards.name: Ogre Enforcer
cards.text: Ogre Enforcer can't be destroyed by lethal damage unless lethal damage dealt by a single source is marked on it.
cards.flavor:
"Ate up all of his siblings in the first week. A good beginning for one destined to command."
—Suka, ogre matron

rulings.text: If its toughness falls to zero or less and it is undamaged, it will still be put into the graveyard.
The check for nonlethal damage is done on a per-source basis. So each source's damage is checked independently and it is not possible to team up sources (such as creatures) in order to kill it.

cards.originalText: Ogre Enforcer cannot be destroyed by lethal damage unless a single source deals enough damage to destroy it.

cards.name: Raging Gorilla
cards.text: Whenever Raging Gorilla blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Every temper tantrum makes another angry gorilla."
—Femeref children's myth
cards.originalText: If Raging Gorilla blocks or is blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.flavor:
"Flog and Squee / Up the tree / See the army / Flee, flee, flee."
—Goblin nursery rhyme/war cry

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. You may declare an additional attack during your main phase this turn.

cards.name: Rock Slide
cards.text: Rock Slide deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking or blocking creatures without flying.
cards.flavor:
"Good ol' rock. Nothing beats rock."
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

rulings.text: If X is greater than 0, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between one and X targets. If X is 0, you can't choose any targets.

cards.originalText: Rock Slide deals X damage, divided any way you choose, among any number of target attacking or blocking creatures without flying.

cards.name: Solfatara
cards.text:
Target player can't play lands this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"A burst of hot air tossed the moon into the air, and the moon liked it up there so much it never needed the ground again."
—Azeworai, "Glitter Moon"

rulings.text: Prevents all land playing that turn, not just one land.
Does not prevent effects from putting a land onto the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Target player cannot play any land cards this turn. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Song of Blood
cards.text:
Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.
Whenever a creature attacks this turn, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each creature card put into your graveyard this way.
cards.flavor: Purraj sang slaughter and danced death.

rulings.text: If a creature attacks more than once in a turn, it gets the bonus each time.

cards.originalText: Put the top four cards from your library into your graveyard. For each creature card put into your graveyard in this way, all creatures that attack this turn get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Spitting Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: It prefers its meals cooked.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn. You cannot spend more than {R} in this way each turn.

cards.name: Suq'Ata Lancer
cards.text:
Haste
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor:
"Never stop 'til you see your lance come out the other side."
—Telim'Tor
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Suq'Ata Lancer is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Talruum Champion
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Talruum Champion blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature loses first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In the Talruum language, there is no word for "surprised."
cards.originalText:
First strike
Whenever Talruum Champion blocks or is blocked by any creature, that creature loses first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Talruum Piper
cards.text: All creatures with flying able to block Talruum Piper do so.
cards.flavor: When the Talruum began to play, the dragons fell from the sky to squash the obnoxious noise.
cards.originalText: All creatures with flying able to block Talruum Piper do so.

cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor:
"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
cards.originalText: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Viashino Sandstalker
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.flavor:
"Some believe Sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

rulings.text: It is returned to its owner's hand at the end of any turn in which it is on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Viashino Sandstalker is unaffected by summoning sickness.
At the end of any turn, return Viashino Sandstalker to owner's hand.

cards.name: Archangel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor:
"My mother once told me angels sing their swords' names with each strike."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Archangel to tap.

cards.name: Daraja Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Daraja Griffin: Destroy target black creature.
cards.flavor:
"And the flamingos said, 'Get out of our nest—we can't be seen with the likes of you!' So, the griffin ate them."
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"
cards.originalText:
Flying
Sacrifice Daraja Griffin: Destroy target black creature.

cards.name: Equipoise
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, for each land target player controls in excess of the number you control, choose a land that player controls, then the chosen permanents phase out. Repeat this process for artifacts and creatures. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. They phase in before that player untaps during their next untap step.)

rulings.text: In multiplayer games, you can choose a different target player each turn. You can even choose yourself.

You perform the selection and phasing out on lands first, then on artifacts, then on creatures. This means that if you choose an artifact creature during the second pass, your opponent will control one fewer creature when it comes time to perform the third pass.

cards.originalText: During your upkeep, for each land target player controls in excess of the number of lands you control, target land he or she controls phases out. Repeat this process for artifacts and then for creatures.

cards.name: Eye of Singularity
cards.text:
When Eye of Singularity enters the battlefield, destroy each permanent with the same name as another permanent, except for basic lands. They can't be regenerated.
Whenever a permanent other than a basic land enters the battlefield, destroy all other permanents with that name. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: If a copy card enters the battlefield, the permanent it is copying is destroyed and the copy card stays on the battlefield.
Since phasing in does not cause enters-the-battlefield ability to trigger, it is possible to phase in a card which is already on the battlefield and not trigger this effect.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText:
When Eye of Singularity comes into play, bury all permanents with the same name except basic lands.
Whenever any permanent other than a basic land comes into play, bury any permanent already in play with the same name.

cards.name: Freewind Falcon
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"That does it! I'm going back to hunting chickens!"
—Rhirhok, goblin archer
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from red

cards.name: Gossamer Chains
cards.text: Return Gossamer Chains to its owner's hand: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target unblocked creature this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Harah swung his sword mightily, but still the air held him fast."
—Azeworai, "Kenechi's Dream"

rulings.text: The return of this card to your hand is part of the activation cost and is paid on activation. You do not have a choice to pay this cost zero times or more than one time in order to multiply the effect.
A creature is only considered an "unblocked creature" if it is an attacker during combat after blockers are declared.

cards.originalText: Return Gossamer Chains to owner's hand: Target unblocked creature deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Honorable Passage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to any target this turn, prevent that damage. If damage from a red source is prevented this way, Honorable Passage deals that much damage to the source's controller.
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage to you or target creature from any one source. If that source is red, Honorable Passage deals to the source's controller an amount of damage equal to the amount of damage prevented.

cards.name: Hope Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
• Target player gains 2 life.
• Destroy target Aura.
cards.originalText: Choose one Target creature gains first strike until end of turn; or target player gains 2 life; or destroy target local enchantment.

cards.name: Infantry Veteran
cards.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
—Telim'Tor

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Jamuraan Lion
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor:
The lion blinked
—Femeref expression meaning "situation avoided"
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Target creature cannot block this turn.

cards.name: Knight of Valor
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}: Each creature without flanking blocking Knight of Valor gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

rulings.text: The second ability is not Flanking and is not removed by an effect that removes Flanking.

cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}: Each creature without flanking blocking Knight of Valor gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Use this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Longbow Archer
cards.text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"If it bears wings, I will pin it to the skies over Tefemburu."
—Ruya, Zhalfirin archer

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText:
First strike
Longbow Archer can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Miraculous Recovery
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"You stop breathing for just a few minutes and everyone jumps to conclusions."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant
cards.originalText: Put target creature card from your graveyard into play and put a +1/+1 counter on that creature. Treat the creature as though it were just played.

cards.name: Parapet
cards.text:
You may cast Parapet as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
cards.flavor: There is no wall that can't be improved by making it taller.

rulings.text: The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
You may choose to play Parapet as an instant; if you do, bury it at end of turn.
All creatures you control get +0/+1.

cards.name: Peace Talks
cards.text: This turn and next turn, creatures can't attack, and players and permanents can't be the targets of spells or activated abilities.
cards.flavor:
"By the tongues of a thousand serpents, this time I do not lie."
—Ahmahz il Kin, Suq'Ata diplomat

rulings.text: Can be cast after your attack.

It affects the current turn and the next turn. This could affect the same player twice if they have two turns in a row, or it could affect different players. In a multiplayer game it affects exactly two turns, not a full round of turns.
Doesn't skip the Combat Phase, just renders creatures unable to attack.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText: During this turn and the next one, players cannot declare an attack and cannot play spells or abilities that target any permanent or player.

cards.name: Relic Ward
cards.text:
You may cast Relic Ward as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: Asmira's prayers alone should have freed Mangara from the amber prison . . .

rulings.text: Does not destroy Auras which are on the artifact, and it does not prevent Auras from being moved onto the artifact.
The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
You may choose to play Relic Ward as an instant; if you do, bury it at end of turn.
Enchanted artifact cannot be the target of spells or effects.

cards.name: Remedy
cards.text: Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of targets, divided as you choose.
cards.flavor:
"These things will protect you while I'm gone, remind you of my love for you."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

rulings.text: You choose the targets and you choose how to divide up the 5 damage on announcement.
You can't choose zero targets. You must choose at least one target.

cards.originalText: Prevent up to 5 damage total to any number of creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Resistance Fighter
cards.text: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
cards.flavor:
"My soldiers fought without hesitation, died without doubt."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Target creature deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Retribution of the Meek
cards.text: Destroy all creatures with power 4 or greater. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Tread upon the meek, and they shall wound your feet and make you crawl."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
cards.originalText: Bury all creatures with power 4 or greater.

cards.name: Righteous Aura
cards.text: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor:
"Good is not a 'thing.' You can neither touch nor own it. No, Good is a vision we all share and strive to make real."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
cards.originalText: {W}, Pay 2 life: Prevent all damage to you from any one source.

cards.name: Sun Clasp
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"And darkness shall be cast from me
For my soul resides in the Sun."
—Femeref dirge
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return enchanted creature to owner's hand.

cards.name: Teferi's Honor Guard
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{U}{U}: Teferi's Honor Guard phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
cards.flavor:
"They may seem ceremonial, but their swords are still sharp."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{U}{U}: Phase out

cards.name: Tithe
cards.text: Search your library for a Plains card. If target opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for an additional Plains card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Counts lands on resolution, not on announcement.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a plains card. If you control fewer lands than target opponent, you may search your library for an additional plains card. Reveal those cards to all players and put them into your hand. Shuffle your library afterwards.
